result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Bray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

No contact with victim or co defendants, T.C. & A.B.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless valid Rx. Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  Random urinalysis.  No entry into taverns, bars or liquor stores or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Undergo any counseling, treatment or evaluation per agent.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
No good time.  Forthwith.  49 days credit if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: All other conditions that were imposed including payment of costs, fees, restitution to be paid during extended supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Michael A Bray in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Defendant Michael A Bray in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties recv'd and reviewed revocation summary.  389 days credit including today.  DE reads letter of allocution.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1: 
WI State Prison for 7 years (2 years Initial Confinement/5 years Extended Supervision)  
388 days credit
Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Any and all Restitution w/ 15% Surcharge To be paid as part of ES
Any and all Costs & Supervision Fees to be paid as part of ES
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Court goes through waiver information with defendant.  Attorney Martinez agrees with waiver as does defendant.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1. Proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Michael A Bray in court with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Defendant Michael A Bray in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Info.  Count 1 amended.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1: as amended
5 years Probation
6 months Sauk Co. Jail, with work release.  No good time.  49 days credit if revoked.  Forthwith.
DNA surcharge $250/submit to sample
No contact with victim or co-defendants, T.C. & A.B.
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days. 
Random urinalysis
No entry into taverns, bars or liquor stores or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.
Obtain and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.  
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.
AODA & treatment
Restitution with 15% Surcharge To:   J/T with Co-defendants T.C. & A.B.
$268.00 costs & $10.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Michael A Bray in court with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Defendant Michael A Bray in custody.  Michael X Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the motion to modify was not filed.  Attorney Martinez explains.  State objects to motion.  Attorney Martinez argues motion to modify orally.  If bond modified, released and will reside with his mother.  Request signature bond or a $500 cash bond.  State objects and request $1500.00 cash bond.  Court reviews file.  Motion to modify bond denied.

Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Return date on July 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Michael A Bray in court with attorney Andrew I Martinez.  Defendant Michael A Bray in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Martinez just appointed to case.  Waive time limits.  Reset for PTC and RD.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael A Bray by video from LEC with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Defendant Michael A Bray in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Steinman responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/co-actors A.B., or T.C., no contact w/premises at 1103 Connie Rd in Baraboo, no contact w/R.M., J.P., or T.W., not to leave the State of Wisconsin and not to go armed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.  State moves to amend date in charging paragraph of complaint from 5/12/2013 to 5/12/2014.  Court so amends.
